result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis Alberto Cruz-Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by DOC. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.

Defendant Luis Alberto Cruz-Rodriguez in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Luis Alberto Cruz-Rodriguez in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.
Pursuant to negotiations, the state is dismissing and reading in count 1.
As to count 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months days in the House of Correction with credit for 32 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 6-3-2015 at 8:15am Branch 38.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling 
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification.
-No contact with child victim, DRV, dob 11-5-2007 (read in case 14CF5065)
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Luis Alberto Cruz-Rodriguez not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lockwood contacts the court and states that he is ill and cannot appear today and requests date of 2-27-2015.

Defendant Luis Alberto Cruz-Rodriguez in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Luis Alberto Cruz-Rodriguez in custody.  Ron Dague for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Dawn Maldonado.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38 due to a lower pending matter.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ADDRESS INFO for Luis Alberto Cruz-Rodriguez
Current: 333A W MAPLE ST, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 01-31-2015)
Prior: 1218-A West Orchard Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LILLIAN V. (2/17/1988)
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Luis Alberto Cruz-Rodriguez in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Luis Alberto Cruz-Rodriguez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge ROTHSTEIN, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
